name: Jump Awake
subtitle: Best IoT & Best Google Cloud Platform Hack @ XdHacks 2019
description: An IoT alarm that gets you active in the morning by requiring users to do physical exercise routines such as jumping jacks, squats, burpees, sit ups in order to shut off the alarm.

name: Who Said What
subtitle: Winner of Wolfram Award @ nwHacks 2019
description: Show who's saying what and transcribes speakers in real time, then exports the meeting minutes to Google Sheets.

name: Miru
subtitle: 2nd Place @ Hack Washington 2019
description: Miru makes discovering new places and seeing the world easier for the visually impaired. All the functionality in Miru is activated using voice, and the feedback is also in audio-form, which means it’s super accessible for the visually impaired.

name: Spotty
subtitle: 1st Place @ Ryerson University Hacks 2018
description: Spotty advertises your unused parking spaces to drivers who are looking for parking. Using IoT, Spotty uses cameras and sensors to provide automated security, and the status of your parking space ensuring that your property is safe.

name: Alexa Assignment Deadlines
subtitle: 2nd Place @ UBC Canvas Hackathon 2018
description: An Alexa skill to tell you your assignment deadlines, just say "open assignment deadlines".

name: Review Me
subtitle: Winner of AWS Prize @ Hack the Valley 2
description: Automatic notifications to remind PR reviewers, multi-repo issue list, and slack notifications for unread Github notifications for better productivity.

name: UBC Course Schedule Creator
subtitle: Personal Project
description: A website that offers UBC students all the possible schedules that can be made, given the courses they wish to take.

name: Desktop Launcher
subtitle: Top Group Project in CPEN 391
description: A toy turret that can aim, take photos, and be fired by the user.

name: Food Shake
subtitle: Personal Project
description: An Android application to solve “Where should we eat?” situations by randomly selecting a nearby restaurant on phone shake.
